Description: Terracotta lamp. Applied vertical band-handle. Discus decorated with a wheel pattern. Shoulder, on each side: above a row of raised points, hounds, one crouching, one seated. Nozzle-top shows a hound. Raised edge round wick-hole. Flat, pointed oval base. Pinkish-brown clay, with mica covered with a red slip. Handle lost. Blackened spout.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2227)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
